metadata.title: Intermediate Week 1 — Accumulation Phase Begins
metadata.progressionFocus: Build volume from 12-14 sets per muscle group

microcycleOutput.overview: Week 1 — Accumulation Phase Begins. This is your first week of the 16-week hypertrophy block. The goal is to establish baseline volume (12-14 sets per muscle group) and build work capacity. Intensity is moderate (RPE 7-8 on compounds, RPE 8 on accessories) to allow for progressive volume accumulation over the next 6 weeks. Focus on quality reps, controlled tempo, and mind-muscle connection. You'll train 6 days per week using a Push/Pull/Legs split, hitting each muscle group 2x per week. Rest periods: 2-3min for compounds, 60-90sec for accessories. Track all your lifts—you'll reference these numbers as volume increases.
days: Day 1 (Monday) — Push: Chest & Shoulders Emphasis. Start the week fresh with heavy pressing movements. Volume: Compounds 3-4 sets of 6-10 reps, accessories 3 sets of 10-15 reps. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min + band pull-aparts 2x15, (2) Barbell Bench Press 4x8 @ RPE 7-8 (2-3min rest), (3) Incline Dumbbell Press 3x10 @ RPE 8 (90sec rest), (4) Dumbbell Lateral Raise 3x12 @ RPE 8, (5) Overhead Press 3x8 @ RPE 7-8, (6) Cable Fly 3x12 @ RPE 8, (7) Tricep Pushdown 3x15 @ RPE 8, (8) Cooldown 5min. Track: Bench __lbs, Incline DB __lbs, OHP __lbs. Note: First session sets the baseline. Don't chase PRs—establish repeatable weights.

Day 2 (Tuesday) — Pull: Back & Biceps. Antagonist pairing distributes upper body recovery. Volume: Same as Monday (compounds 3-4 sets, accessories 3 sets). Session: (1) Warm-up 5min + scapular pull-ups 2x10, (2) Barbell Row 4x8 @ RPE 7-8 (2-3min rest), (3) Weighted Pull-up 3x8 @ RPE 8 OR Lat Pulldown 3x10 (90sec rest), (4) Chest-Supported Row 3x10 @ RPE 8, (5) Face Pull 3x15 @ RPE 7 (rear delt focus), (6) Barbell Curl 3x10 @ RPE 8, (7) Hammer Curl 3x12 @ RPE 8, (8) Cooldown 5min. Track: BB Row __lbs, Pull-up/Pulldown __lbs, BB Curl __lbs.

Day 3 (Wednesday) — Legs: Quad Emphasis. Mid-week leg session focuses on knee-dominant movements. Volume: 3-4 sets per exercise. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min + bodyweight squats 2x10, leg swings, (2) Barbell Back Squat 4x8 @ RPE 7-8 (2-3min rest), (3) Leg Press 3x12 @ RPE 8 (90sec rest), (4) Bulgarian Split Squat 3x10/leg @ RPE 8, (5) Leg Extension 3x15 @ RPE 8-9 (push close to failure on isolation), (6) Calf Raise 3x15 @ RPE 8, (7) Ab Wheel 3x10 @ RPE 8, (8) Cooldown 5min. Track: Squat __lbs, Leg Press __lbs. Note: Quad emphasis today, posterior chain on Saturday.

Day 4 (Thursday) — Push: Triceps & Front Delts. Second push day with different exercise selection. Volume: Same structure, slightly different focus. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Incline Barbell Bench Press 4x8 @ RPE 7-8 (variation from Monday's flat bench), (3) Dumbbell Shoulder Press 3x10 @ RPE 8, (4) Cable Crossover 3x12 @ RPE 8, (5) Dips 3x10 @ RPE 8 (weighted if possible), (6) Lateral Raise (cable or DB) 3x12 @ RPE 8, (7) Overhead Tricep Extension 3x12 @ RPE 8, (8) Cooldown 5min. Track: Incline BB __lbs, DB Shoulder Press __lbs, Dips (weight added __lbs).

Day 5 (Friday) — Pull: Rear Delts & Biceps. Second pull day completes 2x frequency for back. Volume: Same as Tuesday. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Deadlift 3x6 @ RPE 7-8 (slightly lower reps, very taxing), (3) Lat Pulldown (wide grip) 3x10 @ RPE 8, (4) Seated Cable Row 3x12 @ RPE 8, (5) Reverse Fly (machine or DB) 3x15 @ RPE 8 (rear delt focus), (6) Preacher Curl 3x10 @ RPE 8, (7) Cable Curl 3x12 @ RPE 8, (8) Cooldown 5min. Track: Deadlift __lbs, Lat Pulldown __lbs, Preacher Curl __lbs. Note: Deadlift at lower volume (3 sets) to manage lower back fatigue.

Day 6 (Saturday) — Legs: Hamstring & Glute Emphasis. Second leg day targets posterior chain. Volume: 3 sets per exercise. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min + glute bridges 2x15, (2) Romanian Deadlift 4x10 @ RPE 7-8, (3) Hip Thrust (barbell or Smith machine) 3x12 @ RPE 8, (4) Leg Curl (lying or seated) 3x12 @ RPE 8-9, (5) Walking Lunge 3x12/leg @ RPE 7, (6) Seated Calf Raise 3x15 @ RPE 8, (7) Plank 3x45sec, (8) Cooldown 5min. Track: RDL __lbs, Hip Thrust __lbs. Note: Complements Wednesday's quad work—full lower body coverage.

Day 7 (Sunday) — Rest (or optional Zone 2 cardio). Complete rest or 20-30min easy cardio (bike, incline walk, rowing). Purpose: Recover for Monday's push session. This is Week 1 baseline—next week you'll add 1-2 sets to 1-2 exercises. Reflect: How did the volume feel? Any exercises feel too easy or too hard? Adjust weights next week accordingly. Sleep 8+ hours, eat 0.8-1g protein per lb bodyweight, aim for slight calorie surplus (~10%).

metadata.title: Intermediate Week 7 — Deload Phase
metadata.progressionFocus: Reduce volume by 50%, dissipate accumulated fatigue

microcycleOutput.overview: Week 7 — Deload Phase. After 6 weeks of volume accumulation (you've increased from 12-14 sets to 18-20 sets per muscle group), your body needs active recovery. This week, volume drops by 50%—you'll cut sets in half while maintaining exercise selection and moderate intensity (70-80% of your working weights, RPE 6-7). The goal is NOT to push for PRs or test maxes. Focus on movement quality, technique refinement, and letting accumulated fatigue dissipate. You'll still train 6 days following the same PPL split, but sessions will be shorter (~40min vs 60min). This deload prepares you for the intensification phase (Weeks 9-14) where you'll push intensity higher. Sleep, nutrition, and stress management are priorities this week.
days: Day 1 (Monday) — Push: Chest & Shoulders (Deload). Volume reduced: Cut to 2 sets per exercise. Intensity moderate (70-80% of working weights). Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Barbell Bench Press 2x8 @ 70-80% of Week 6 weight (e.g., if you were using 200lbs, use 140-160lbs), (3) Incline Dumbbell Press 2x10 @ reduced weight, (4) Dumbbell Lateral Raise 2x12, (5) Overhead Press 2x8 @ reduced weight, (6) Cable Fly 2x12, (7) Cooldown 5min. Notes: Rest 2min between all sets (no rush). Focus on crisp, clean reps. No tricep work today (reduced accessory volume). Track: How did deload weights feel? Too light? Too heavy? Adjust for Week 8 if needed.

Day 2 (Tuesday) — Pull: Back & Biceps (Deload). Volume reduced: 2 sets per exercise. Same moderate intensity. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Barbell Row 2x8 @ 70-80% of Week 6 weight, (3) Weighted Pull-up 2x8 OR Lat Pulldown 2x10 @ reduced weight, (4) Chest-Supported Row 2x10, (5) Face Pull 2x15, (6) Barbell Curl 2x10, (7) Cooldown 5min. Notes: No hammer curls today (reduced accessory volume). Sessions should feel refreshing, not exhausting. If you're sore from Week 6, this week allows recovery.

Day 3 (Wednesday) — Legs: Quad Emphasis (Deload). Volume reduced: 2 sets per exercise. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Barbell Back Squat 2x8 @ 70-80% of Week 6 weight, (3) Leg Press 2x12 @ reduced weight, (4) Bulgarian Split Squat 2x10/leg, (5) Leg Extension 2x15, (6) Cooldown 5min. Notes: No calf raises or ab work today (reduced accessory volume). Focus on squat depth and control. This is active recovery, not a test session.

Day 4 (Thursday) — Push: Triceps & Front Delts (Deload). Volume reduced: 2 sets per exercise. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Incline Barbell Bench Press 2x8 @ 70-80% of Week 6 weight, (3) Dumbbell Shoulder Press 2x10, (4) Cable Crossover 2x12, (5) Dips 2x10 @ reduced weight, (6) Cooldown 5min. Notes: No lateral raises or overhead tricep extensions (reduced volume). Should finish in ~35-40min.

Day 5 (Friday) — Pull: Rear Delts & Biceps (Deload). Volume reduced: 2 sets per exercise. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Deadlift 2x6 @ 70-80% of Week 6 weight (very conservative—deadlift fatigue is systemic), (3) Lat Pulldown 2x10, (4) Seated Cable Row 2x12, (5) Reverse Fly 2x15, (6) Cooldown 5min. Notes: No preacher curls or cable curls (reduced bicep volume). Deadlift should feel light and crisp. If lower back is fatigued, skip deadlift entirely this week.

Day 6 (Saturday) — Legs: Hamstring & Glute Emphasis (Deload). Volume reduced: 2 sets per exercise. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Romanian Deadlift 2x10 @ 70-80% of Week 6 weight, (3) Hip Thrust 2x12, (4) Leg Curl 2x12, (5) Cooldown 5min. Notes: No walking lunges, calf raises, or planks (reduced volume). Short session (~30min). You should leave the gym feeling refreshed, not drained.

Day 7 (Sunday) — Rest or Active Recovery. Suggested: 30min easy walk, yoga, stretching, foam rolling, sauna. This is Week 7 of 16—you're almost halfway through the block. Week 8 is also a deload (same structure as this week). After Week 8, you begin intensification (Weeks 9-14) where intensity ramps up to RPE 8-9 and you'll incorporate rest-pause sets, drop sets, and slow eccentrics. Use this week to recover fully. Sleep 8-9 hours, manage stress, eat at maintenance calories.

metadata.title: Intermediate Week 13 — Intensification Phase Peak
metadata.progressionFocus: Increase load/intensity, maintain volume 14-16 sets, RPE 8-9

microcycleOutput.overview: Week 13 — Intensification Phase Peak. You're in the final stretch of the intensification block (Weeks 9-14). Volume is stabilized at 14-16 sets per muscle group, but intensity is high (RPE 8-9 on most sets). You've been adding 5-10lbs to compounds when hitting the top of the rep range, and by Week 13 you should be significantly stronger than Week 1. This week incorporates advanced intensity techniques: rest-pause sets (on 1-2 exercises per session), drop sets (on isolation work), and slow eccentrics (3-4sec negatives on accessories). These techniques push closer to muscular failure and maximize hypertrophy stimulus. Rest periods: 2-3min for compounds, 90sec for accessories, 60sec for isolation. Train with intent—every rep should be quality. You'll feel fatigued by the end of the week, but that's expected. Week 15-16 is your final deload and assessment block.
days: Day 1 (Monday) — Push: Chest & Shoulders Emphasis (Intensification). Volume: Compounds 4 sets, accessories 3 sets. Intensity: RPE 8-9. Advanced techniques: Rest-pause on bench press final set. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min + activation work, (2) Barbell Bench Press 4x6-8 @ RPE 8-9 (Set 4: rest-pause = hit failure at 6-8 reps, rest 15sec, do 2-3 more reps, rest 15sec, do 1-2 more reps), (3) Incline Dumbbell Press 3x8-10 @ RPE 8-9 (slow eccentric: 3-4sec descent), (4) Dumbbell Lateral Raise 3x10-12 @ RPE 9 (drop set on final set: hit failure, reduce weight by 30%, continue to failure), (5) Overhead Press 3x6-8 @ RPE 8-9, (6) Cable Fly 3x10-12 @ RPE 9, (7) Tricep Pushdown 3x12-15 @ RPE 9, (8) Cooldown 5min. Notes: Rest-pause is taxing—only on 1 compound per session. Track: Did you add weight to any lift since Week 12? If yes, you're progressing.

Day 2 (Tuesday) — Pull: Back & Biceps (Intensification). Volume: Same as Monday. Advanced techniques: Rest-pause on barbell row, drop set on curls. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Barbell Row 4x6-8 @ RPE 8-9 (Set 4: rest-pause), (3) Weighted Pull-up 3x6-8 @ RPE 9 OR Lat Pulldown 3x8-10 @ RPE 9 (slow eccentric: 3-4sec lower), (4) Chest-Supported Row 3x8-10 @ RPE 8-9, (5) Face Pull 3x12-15 @ RPE 8, (6) Barbell Curl 3x8-10 @ RPE 9 (drop set on final set), (7) Hammer Curl 3x10-12 @ RPE 9, (8) Cooldown 5min. Notes: Pull-ups with added weight should be challenging by rep 6-8. If bodyweight is still easy, add more weight.

Day 3 (Wednesday) — Legs: Quad Emphasis (Intensification). Volume: 4 sets compounds, 3 sets accessories. Advanced techniques: Rest-pause on squats, drop set on leg extensions. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min + mobility, (2) Barbell Back Squat 4x6-8 @ RPE 8-9 (Set 4: rest-pause if feeling strong, OR just push to RPE 9.5), (3) Leg Press 3x10-12 @ RPE 8-9 (slow eccentric: 3-4sec lower), (4) Bulgarian Split Squat 3x8-10/leg @ RPE 8-9, (5) Leg Extension 3x12-15 @ RPE 9 (drop set on final set: failure, reduce 30%, failure again), (6) Calf Raise 3x12-15 @ RPE 8, (7) Ab Wheel 3x12 @ RPE 8, (8) Cooldown 5min. Notes: Squats should feel heavy. If you hit 4x8 cleanly, add 5-10lbs next week.

Day 4 (Thursday) — Push: Triceps & Front Delts (Intensification). Volume: Same structure. Advanced techniques: Drop set on cable crossover, slow eccentrics on dips. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Incline Barbell Bench Press 4x6-8 @ RPE 8-9, (3) Dumbbell Shoulder Press 3x8-10 @ RPE 8-9, (4) Cable Crossover 3x10-12 @ RPE 9 (drop set on final set), (5) Dips 3x8-10 @ RPE 9 (slow eccentric: 3-4sec lower), (6) Lateral Raise 3x10-12 @ RPE 9, (7) Overhead Tricep Extension 3x10-12 @ RPE 9, (8) Cooldown 5min. Notes: Dips with slow eccentrics are brutal—control the descent, explode up.

Day 5 (Friday) — Pull: Rear Delts & Biceps (Intensification). Volume: Same. Advanced techniques: Slow eccentric on lat pulldown, drop set on cable curl. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Deadlift 3x5-6 @ RPE 8-9 (lower reps, higher intensity than Week 1), (3) Lat Pulldown 3x8-10 @ RPE 9 (slow eccentric: 3-4sec lower), (4) Seated Cable Row 3x10-12 @ RPE 8-9, (5) Reverse Fly 3x12-15 @ RPE 9, (6) Preacher Curl 3x8-10 @ RPE 9, (7) Cable Curl 3x10-12 @ RPE 9 (drop set on final set), (8) Cooldown 5min. Notes: Deadlift at RPE 8-9 is very taxing. Rest 3min between sets.

Day 6 (Saturday) — Legs: Hamstring & Glute Emphasis (Intensification). Volume: 3-4 sets. Advanced techniques: Drop set on leg curls. Session: (1) Warm-up 5min, (2) Romanian Deadlift 4x8-10 @ RPE 8-9, (3) Hip Thrust 3x10-12 @ RPE 9, (4) Leg Curl 3x10-12 @ RPE 9 (drop set on final set), (5) Walking Lunge 3x10-12/leg @ RPE 8, (6) Seated Calf Raise 3x12-15 @ RPE 8, (7) Plank 3x60sec, (8) Cooldown 5min. Notes: RDL should be challenging by rep 8-10. You've been building strength for 12 weeks—weights should be significantly higher than Week 1.

Day 7 (Sunday) — Rest or Optional Light Cardio. Suggested: 20-30min Zone 2 cardio (easy bike, incline walk) OR complete rest. This is Week 13 of 16. One more week of intensification (Week 14), then you enter final deload and assessment (Weeks 15-16). Reflect: Compare Week 13 weights to Week 1 baseline. How much have you added to bench? Squat? Deadlift? Take progress photos this weekend if you haven't recently. Sleep 8-9 hours, eat adequate protein and calories. You should feel strong but fatigued—that's the intensification phase working.
